article.headline: Canisius 75, Detroit 72
article.story: DETROIT (AP) -- Chuck Harris scored 17 points Saturday and Canisius broke a three-game losing streak with a 75-72 victory at Detroit. Pawel Malesa hit his fourth 3-pointer of the day with less than three minutes to play to give the Golden Griffins (3-6) the lead for good. It was the last of 15 lead changes in the second half. Harris, a Detroit native, added a 3-pointer a minute after Malesa's to give the Griffins a five-point cushion in the final minute. The Titans rallied and had a chance to tie the game but Jon Goode's running 3-point attempt bounced off the rim as the buzzer sounded. Ryvon Coville had a career-high 25 points and 13 rebounds for Detroit (2-7), which lost its third straight. Goode added 16 points and Chris Hayes had 12 and five assists. Canisius trailed by as many as eight points early, but an 11-2 run in the final three minutes of the first half gave the Griffins a 34-33 lead at intermission. Darnell Wilson had 15 points and Malesa finished with 12. Frank Turner scored 11 and had eight assists for Canisius.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
